result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant will have no further contacts w/law enforcement during term of agrmt. that give rise to probable cause for arrest due to criminal conduct.
2)Defendant shall notify Pepin County District Attorney's Office of any change of residence or employment.
3)Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or enter into bars or taverns.  
4)Defendant must submit to random drug and alcohol testing within 3 hours of the request of the DA and pay all fees associated with testing.....
5)No contact with PMF
6)Complete a Mental Health Assessment and follow through with any recommendations put forth.....
7)Take all medications as directed and prescribed by a medical professional.
8)One month prior to completion of contract, defendant must contact Pepin County District Attorney's Office for a final interview.
9)Defendant must report in person as requested by the Pepin County District Attorney or other supervisor designated by him.
10) The defendant must follow the rules and regulations as set forth by probation, if applicable.

supervisions.notes: To be paid in installments of $100.00 per month commencing 12-01-2022 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full.
With work release privileges if eligible.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. A.J. Gerald Gene Frederickson

records.addlTxt: 02:01 PM Defendant A.J. Gerald Gene Frederickson appeared by zoom technology by phone means with Attorney Melissa M. Petersen. Prosecuting Atty Jon D. Seifert appeared for State of Wisconsin by phone means.  Settlement reached.  Defendant will plead to count 1 as repeater and enter into DAGPA for 2 years, agreement signed has been electronically filed.  Conditions of agreement.  On count 1 ask court accept DAGP and State filed Information.  On count 2 parties agree to plea and joint recommendation 90 days straight jail time in the PCJ.  Attorney Petersen requests 60 days to report on jail time.  Court advises right to PH.  Defendant waives right to PH.  Court finds Mr. Frederickson kvi waives statutory right to PH.  Court advises defendant of charge in count 1 as a repeater/max. penalties; advised of charge in count 2 as a repeater.  Defendant agrees to conduct this hearing in this fashion as well as Attorney Petersen.  Advised of constitutional rights.  Court reviews DAGPA in count 1.  Court reviews the conditions of the contract.  Mental health assessment to be started within 90 days of release from jail and provide authorization to the DA to monitor progress in that program.  If you adhere to the contract the matter would be dismissed and if not, you could return to court and subject to the max. penalties.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Court defers acceptance of plea and defer for 2 years.  To count 2 defendant pleads no contest, court finds you guilty.  Court will impose 90 days jail to report 8/28 at 6 p.m. with work release if eligible for huber release.  Court costs $443.00 to be paid $100/mo. com. 12/1 to Pepin Co. Clerk of Court.  Advised of appeal rights.
Proposed - Deferred Acceptance of Guilty or No Contest Plea Agreement - Signed
Adjourned initial appearance on June 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:20 AM Defendant A.J. Gerald Gene Frederickson appeared by zoom technology by phone means. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Mr. Frederickson appeared on 4/5 and was informed of his charges and rights.  Defendant has no questions. Mr. Frederickson requested time to talk to an attorney at the last hearing.  Mr. Frederickson contacted the PD office and was approved but they don't have anyone appointed and informed me to ask for 30 days.  Defendant confirms his address on file.  Next hearing to be in person.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 3, 2022 at 10:15 am.

02:18 PM Defendant A.J. Gerald Gene Frederickson appeared by zoom technology by phone means without counsel. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and constitutional rights.  Defendant requests time to contact an attorney.  Defendant requests a hearing in the morning and confirms his address on file.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 10:15 am.

02:00 PM Defendant A.J. Gerald Gene Frederickson appeared by zoom technology by phone means.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Mr. Frederickson not on the court calendar.  Mr. Frederickson received paperwork when arrested to appear today at 1:30 PM  State asks court set this matter aside until State makes a charging decision.  Defendant confirms his address on his paperwork.  Matter adjourned.
